info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:56PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Davie and northwestern Rowan Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Mocksville, or 4 miles west of Cooleemee, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mocksville, Cooleemee, Cleveland, Fork Church, Farmington, Woodleaf and Piedmont Research Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
